author: THaighton
title: Hospital visit
body:
My mum fell while out on and hurt her ankle. We attended RVH fracture clinic where we met a lovely nurse Caroline. Caroline showed compassion and excellent care that really stood out to us even though they were busy.  
Mums ankle was broken and Caroline took time to cast and explain everything. The HSC Values shone through her and I believe she should be acknowledged for that!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lucky57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The care cannot be faulted
body: I came into hospital a few days ago and my A& E experience was fine and I was given all the medical attention I needed. I really couldn't ask for better care in the Acute Medical Unit. I have see care all over the world through travelling and the care here is truly second to none. The staff are just fantastic and it seems like it's not just a job to them but rather they really care for each patient they see. They are so busy but they devote time to individuals. The ward is very clean and I couldn't fault the cleanliness at all. I have been kept well informed every step of my hospital stay and if I ever don't understand something that one of the doctors has said, the nurses later on are more than willing to break it down into layman's terms for me which is so helpful. I am used to spending time on my own but being in a shared ward didn't bother me at all and I really enjoyed the social aspect of having someone else in this with me almost and being able to sympathize with each other. All in all the care in Craigavon cannot be faulted and I am so grateful to the team in the AMU for making my time in hospital much more pleasant.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: staff in emergency department at CAH are perfect, couldnt ask for better
body: I came into ED with my son this morning. We are now waiting for his meds to be prescribed. I understand people always complain about waiting times but this is  not the staffs fault. When you go to ED you know there will be a wait. The staff are perfect, I couldn't ask for better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: my time in the amber zone in ED
body: I cam in yesterday. The place is comfortable and they got me a better chair as I have to sit upright to improve my breathing which was good. However, I feel the communication could improve. I feel confused with the information im being given. one nurse came and said I need air from the wall to help breath and a while later and nurse came saying no you arent to be on that you need a mask with oxygen. Then I was told I have penumonia and another staff a while later said I dont think you have penumonia. I just feel lost and feel like I dont know what is actually going on. The food has been really good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff in CAH are first class and the paramedics
body: I came in a few days ago by ambulance to ED on saturday. The first responder to me was a paramedic named Shane and he was so caring and nice making me feel at ease as this was my first experience of having a turn so I felt scared. I felt the ambulance crew were very organised and quick, they knew what they were at. I got a bed quickly/ The food has been very good. I asked for more fluids and drinks and the staff were prompt and addressed my request well. When you need something they are very good at helping.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Amu staff are great, feeling 10 times better than on ambulance arrival last week
body: The ambulance came quickly last week and I got a bed in no time, which was great. The ambulance crew and the staff here have been brilliant, they couldnt be more helpful. The food is also great which is a bonus. I am now feeling ten times better than I was on arrival and I am so happy so thankyou all

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: the food menu needs more variety for vegetarians and more toilets on wards- 1 north
body: I transferred from daisy hill to CAH and I have been here for 4 weeks. The staff have been really great, I couldnt fault them at all from cleaner to tea trolly to nursing staff. I do wish there were more toilets available on the wards, as It is a long trip down the corridor and you have to wait around if it is occupied and can be distressing if feeling unwell. As a vegetarian, I think there should be more variety on the menu to suit that. The ward is very clean and friendly.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: dougie123
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: you couldnt ask for better staff than in 1 north CAH
body: I am up here on holiday so came in by car to the emergency department recently. I waited around 4-5hours which was okay as I understand the wait in ED. The staff have been absolutely super, I couldnt be in better hands. The food is nice and the cleanliness is thorough.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: BH49
title: Not positive experiences
body: Both phone and face to face contact have not been positive experiences. The staff have been quite rude and have required things chasing up with them. They don't seem to know their patients very well. I called on behalf of a patient and the person I spoke to seemed to be playing hardball for a simple request for a fit note, on behalf of somebody with multiple healthcare needs! First of all the online form doesn't work (why put a system on your website that doesn't work?), I was then asked if the patient has received a fit note for 'this illness' before and I said I'm sure they probably have, to which the staff member replied that that haven't, but then saying it was issued 2020. I was puzzled as to why I was asked if they knew already!?This behaviour seemed to display that they thought it was a fraudulent request. If they knew about the patient, medical records will show they have multiple medical issues including being unable to walk unaided. The tone of the staff member I found incredibly rude and dismissive. Lacking any knowledge or empathy for the patient.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: drnon
title: Quayside medical practice
body: Have rang 37 times over 2 days each time its engaged. Called into practice but told to ring. Rang number on website which is a message only, very poor.

author: hipposk56
title: Repeat prescriptions take 6 working days
body:
The online system may say to be collected 4 days later but they don't say the day of request is not counted and while the doctor may sign the script in a morning, it will not be with the next door pharmacist until late in the afternoon.  
I have learnt the hard way not to make the 20 minute walk to collect a prescription until the 6th day.  
The pharmacists and assistants are very sympathetic but the advice to speak to a surgery receptionist - especially by phone- seldom improves the situation.  
Doctors appointments are very seldom, getting past the hurdles is considerably time consuming and frustrating. Usually result with a phone consultation with a nurse, who can not prescribe or alter a prescription.  
There is no contact from the surgery regarding test results. A note on the patients records say 'patient informed'- but only if they can and do look online. Phone calls about test results must be made after 11am but the one line queue can take nearly an hour.

author: Amicles
title: The e-consult form didn't work
body:
Used the e-consult form on the website on Monday and now Thursday evening without hearing anything back at all. I'd have been better phoning and arranging an appointment like normal. So much for modern technology making things easier for both them and us! God alone knows how long I'll have to wait to get an appointment now.  
I've been saying for years we should move GP's and I think this might be the final shove we need. To be honest this is a minor drop in the ocean of what we've experienced and certainly not the driving force behind this decision. I personally believe there are many better practices than this one has proven to be. This practice has let my family and me down on multiple occasions even twice, resulting in urgent surgery that could have been avoided if they actually listened to us!

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff in 1 north are great and the tea ladies are so friendly and good company.
body: The staff here are great and I love how they call you by name and have a conversation with you rather than keep it all work related. I have been here 5 weeks and the cleanliness is top class. My only issue is the lack of vegetarian options on the menu as I am not a fan of meat.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff in 1 north are very observant and friendly.
body: I came to one north from Daisy Hill. The staff have been very good and observant in monitoring my monitors. There is now a dialysis machine in my room which is superb as I dont have to travel now to other wards etc for it. The staff are so attentive and constantly pop in to check if everything is okay. I just wish there were mirrors for shaving or even a table or shelf to place shaving stuff or clothes when washing in the bathroom than on the floor, which feels unhygienic. More clothing lockers would also come in handy. I also would love to see a salad option on the food menu even once  while, as I cant eat breads and struggle with some of the other options.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: staff are great in ED CAH
body: I came into ED on thursday and came up to 4 north then. The staff have been great and will do anything for you in both ED and the ward. I was so pleased that I was seen to in ED within 3 hours. However, I do wish there was some variety on the food menu

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Shawx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My time in the AMU CAH
body: I came in on saturday night to ED after having a blackout. I wanted there from 11pm to 7am on such hard uncomfortable chairs. I was afraid of having another blackout and falling off the chair and hitting my head and being worse. The staff were great though. Then I was moved to the AMU, I am happy here as its more comfortable, the staff are very good and the food is nice

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: gerald123
title: I feel like there is lack of communication
body:
The staff and food in the AMU is excellent, however I feel like there is lack of communication in explaining medical things to me.  
I came into the emergency department last week by ambulance and spent a night there in Resuss before moving to the acute medical unit. The staff here are really nice, every single one of them. I am very happy with my side room and cleanliness. The tv remote is missing so I feel quite bored with nothing to do, as im not the best with technology or phones. The food is beautiful and is honestly the highlight of my day.  
My only issue is a lack of communication about my medical diagnosis and treatment. I have kidney and heart failure, so I assumed when I came to ED ill, it was due to one of those conditions I have. I was soon told I had an aggressive lung cancer, so I asked how long do I have, thinking in terms of Do I have less than 5 years or like ten years.... I was told its only weeks I have. This was a huge shock to me, I dont even think it has hit. I felt so scared and anxious with so many questions but no doctor has been by in a while.  
I feel scared and not informed as to what my next treatment plan is, where do we go from here, more on my diagnosis. My daughters also feel there is a lack of information too. However, today after speaking to the medical student who came round asking for my feedback on Care Opinion, she asked the deputy sister for a doctor to call round for a private chat to help me understand and maybe put my mind at ease. Hopefully this takes place

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Andrew B
title: My experience with occupational therapy.
body:
My doctor had signed me up for occupational therapy as a way to help me with my anxiety and depression. The occupational therapist assigned to me was Katrina.  
I am glad that I got to speak with Katrina as personally she really helped me in finding ways to cope with my anxiety and depression at times, Katrina done everything you would expect from an occupational therapist and so much more as being able to speak with someone who can actually understand in some level what you are experiencing really helps.  
Katrina had took the time to get helpful information for not just me but for me to be able to help my friend who at this time is unmotivated and really unhealthy, by sending me all kinds of information from how to control and document what you do in the day to from how everything you eat and drink effects levels of stress, anxiety, laziness etc, all the things Katrina took the time to do didn't just help me it helped my friend as well, and for that she gained my utmost respect.  
If all occupational therapists are just like Katrina Taylor then so many people's mental health is going to become easier to manage and control.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: ejbsss
title: Accessing the right help
body:
I suffer with anxiety and periods of depression since as long as I can remember. I first sought help at 17 years old and due to my age (nearly an adult) I was accidentally referred to the wrong service and passed between therapy providers quite a bit.  
My GP had put me on antidepressants which had unfavourable side effects (nausea, weight-gain, headaches & libido difficulties) and I honestly felt more abandoned and hopeless than before seeking help in the first place.  
After trying various therapies (group therapy & CBT) as well as various medications, Ealing IAPT suggested that I try CfD therapy.  
In this process I have learned so much about myself, making connections between my thoughts, actions and feelings has been a powerful tool in making positive changes in my patterns and beliefs.  
I’m not ‘cured’ but I have come a long way. Coming from a dark place, I now have a better perspective and I’m more able to deeply understand and support myself. I’m working on being able to reflect effectively without being critical.  
Extremely grateful for the opportunity to undergo the CfD process and with a highly skilled and patient therapist (Ms. Masawi).

author: Elderly Patient
title: Waiting times for an oral biopsy after seeing consultant
body:
My husband was seen by a consultant at DDH and told a biopsy is required , as may have pre cancerous cells orally.  
Was told by the consultant it would be July as my husband works three week shifts offshore.  
He was first seen in June 2012.  
I believe your targets are to be seen in 12 weeks .  
I told receptionist that my husbands shift patterns, yet they sent appointment for Aug when he is away. Receptionist said next appointment is Sept which means that is 13 weeks and breaking guidelines, and as an non-medical member of staff I felt their comment that it wasn't their fault my husband works away. Then added if it was urgent he would be seen at Ninewells oral surgery within two weeks of first consultation which is clinical information that should not be given out as not qualified to do so. Also should not be discussing the patient with me about clinical matters .

author: sagittarr83
title: Operation under local anaesthetic
body: I attended FVRH on Friday for an operation on  what turned out to be a very large cyst above my left ear underneath the scalp.   I was  attended by Barbara with Joanne and Chris.   I was treated very well and the sense of humour was good.   Very caring people and put me at ease throughout the procedure.   I was amazed at the lack of waiting time and the relaxed atmosphere in the room was great.     Thanks all.

author: violethd96
title: Coil experience
body: It was first time that I had a coil put in. The nurses are explaining the stages and the risks. My experience was brilliant thank you the nurses they are so helpful and they respect me

author: SickoftheNHS
title: Duty of care to me as a patient is being disregarded
body:
I moved out of the area and notified the practice in January 21, where they responded and asked me to fill in some forms and they would let me know the decision the partners made about whether or not I could remain a patient. I heard nothing back, and my address details were updated, so I thought nothing more of it.  
Six months later, I returned to the practice to have some stitches removed (btw, I had continued to have regular consults with my GP throughout this time), and the receptionist recognised me and noted that my address was outside their area. They commented to me that I would have to find a new GP and I tried to explain that I had already filled in the paperwork to remain a patient. They ignored me and two weeks later, I received a letter from the practice saying I had one month to find a new GP closer to me and that I had been de-registered. I also then received the same letter from the NHS.  
The reasons for me remaining at the practice are very personal, but I have a number of ongoing health issues which require ongoing investigations and treatments and my GP was of the opinion that as long as I was ok to not receive house visits (never have them anyway!) then it shouldn't be a problem and they would request the partners consider that.  
It took me the better part of a month to get someone in the admin team to respond to me and it was only when I sent an email titled 'Complaint', that a manager actually spoke to me. They were very apologetic and said they would call me back the next day after speaking to the partners. They didn't call back. A week later, I chased it up and the next thing I got was an email saying that the partners had agreed to deregister me and that apparently it was a blanket policy. In my complaint, I requested a meeting between myself, my GP and a partner to discuss my situation and what would happen next. Not only did they ignore that, they just disregarded my health entirely.  
The long and the short of it is, I have less than three months to find a new GP before I have zero medical support. If it's a blanket policy, why bother asking people to fill in forms with the change of address? .  
It's infuriating when I finally find a GP I like and trust, and then the bureaucracy of the NHS kicks in and the needs and concerns of patient care go out the window.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Jiglig
title: Poor experience but good locum
body:
My experience of this practice has been poor. I feel staff training needed for all in compassion and how to deal with patients. Constant errors in prescription including wrong dose, running out and virtually having to beg to process on time. In my experience one of the doctors I found rude said it wasnt their problem and didnt have time to process even though I said I was dependant on the medication. I had to ring 111. Excuses for poor behaviour include lack of staff, staff illness (which I understand and is usually covered by locums) and of course Covid (but been having issues for a number of years). Usually no excuse, just rude and patronising.  
On a positive note the two interactions with locum doctors has been amazing and sorted problems/issues immediately without excuses or moaning or blaming others. One locum apologised for the practises behaviour (they didn't need to as wasn't their fault). They were apologising that I wasn't getting the appropriate care. Again, this locum went out of the way to make sure my medical concerns were addressed. See other recent reviews on the web for similar stories.  
From my experience I would not recommend this surgery. It is bad enough having to deal with illness without dealing with this level of incompetence. I don't expect them to read or act on feedback given my previous interactions, I feel like it will be blame others and excuses.

author: scorecardjb99
title: Very poor management of failty in elderly patients in the commuity
body:
I feel that my elderly grandparent's care was very poorly managed by Randalstown Health Cente. A 6 hour wait in A&E that could have very easily been avoided if the practice could have accommodated a genuine complaint. I felt there was no patient centred care and it was a total waste of resources in the midst of a global pandemic. An elderly person with back pain and worsening mobility due to this that needed a pain review by their own GP to prevent this attendance and potential admission.  
If my grandparent hadn't had such a good support network at home this could have been a potential fall or even worse.

author: lincolncockney
title: Dismissive doctor in the emergency department
body:
I have a long term neurological condition which causes me to pass out, have migraines as well as muscle spasms and cognitive issues. I had had a fall and was experiencing increased pain, migraines as well as slurred speech and muscle spasms in my arms and legs.  
I had been directed to A&E by calling 111 and came up to A&E very early on a recent morning. The triage nurse was lovely but the doctor I saw was rude to both my partner and I, as well as being dismissive of my pain and cognitive issues.  
This doctor didn't look at my notes or really ask any questions during the two minute consultation and told me to contact my GP. So I was left in agony for another day.  
My GP diagnosed me with concussion and inflammation of the nerves which should not have been left for 24 hours.

author: Derek42
title: Long wait in A&E and minors
body:
Last week, whilst staying with my son, I passed out at the coast. My wife drove me to Truro Hospital, and I was checked in around lunchtime. I saw the triage nurse within two hours and was eventually transferred to minors at about five and a half hours after checking in.  
I was seated in a cubicle and transferred to a hospital trolley in another cubicle after more than eight hours. I was transferred to a ward early the next morning (over 16 hours after checking in).  
Bearing in mind that I had not eaten since breakfast, there was no water available for me to drink and it was not offered at all until I reached the ward. I was offered some refreshment at around 9pm and I gratefully had an egg roll and a mug of tea. Bear in mind that my collapsing was partly due to dehydration.  
I was aware that A&E were under extreme pressure, I tried not to bother the staff.  
I am 78 years old and unfortunately a heart failure patient, and due to my circumstances at the time I had not given food and drink a lot of thought.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

author: Hidden Veins
title: ACE department Aberedeen Royal Infirmary
body:
I was admitted to ARI in July with Sepsis. My experience whilst on the ward was not a good one and I was really upset and anxious.  
I would like to thank the young Doctor who had studied in Newcastle now working in ward 103 ARI. I was being given antibiotics intravenously, this was difficult as my veins are not easy to find and after several failed attempts this Doctor very gently succeeded in inserting a Canula. I was anxious that the Canula would come out so he found a roll of cotton wool to make a buffer.  
His kindness made a huge difference to me and I'm sure he will be a great Doctor. I would also like to thank the lovely Chinese tea lady and the young porter who made me laugh as he wheeled me backwards along the corridor, I would also like to thank the ex pupil , you made a difference and will go on to be a great nurse.  
My treatment continued as a day patient at the ACE department ARI. I was still feeling poorly and worried but my worries disappeared after meeting Kate, Becky and Doctor Katie. My veins hide behind my arteries and again it proved difficult to inset the permanent Canula. They were absolutely brilliant and refused to give up until they were successful. I have honestly never had such a good time whilst undergoing a medical procedure. They were professional, explained what they were doing and I knew that they wouldn't give up. Thank you to the Banchory Line Crew you are the best of the NHS and lovely human beings. You made a difference!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Gru132
title: Feeling constricted in MRI scanner
body:
During a recent MRI scan I felt very constricted due to its size.  
My last MRI scan was carried out in New Zealand and because they have recognised that people are getting larger, MRI machines have also got larger (the scanning tunnel). What is an uncomfortable experience, particularly if claustrophobic, was made easier by the bigger machine.  
I appreciate that cost plays a part but when a machine has reached an age for replacement then I suggest consideration be given to patient comfort as well as medical requirements.

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I know the staff are doing their best for me
body:
So far I cannot fault the staff, they have been more than good to me and look out for me, helping out with anything they can.  
It's nice to be greeted with a kind welcoming face. I like how all staff introduce themselves, so I know who's underneath the PPE.  
Communication so far has been excellent and I have been kept informed as to waiting times and my treatment. Any questions I have asked are answered in as much detail as the staff can at this stage.  
My wait for a bed has been quite long and I have been on this bed in the ED for the past 12 hours waiting for a bed to become free in the ward, although in this time I have got enough water and food. Although not ideal I am comfortable where I am.  
I am reassured by the staff wearing the appropriate PPE and disposing of items in the waste bin carefully as I know this reduces the risk of COVID for us as patients. I am content with my privacy currently and know the staff are doing their best for me.  
Huge appreciation!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jasudo5186
title: Breathing Easy!
body: I had an appointment at the Pulmonary Function Department at ARI. As someone who has had a roller coaster year healthwise I was a little apprehensive about. I need not have had any worry, Steph the technician who looked after me was absolutely fantastic! ! She was so friendly and patient, ensuring I didn't feel rushed or uncomfortable at any time. The whole experience was made entirely bearable thanks to her friendly and caring approach, thank you!

author: violetms77
title: Nurse at the Health Centre
body:
My wife was diagnosed with multiple myeloma blood cancer last year. She had spinal cord compression due to the tumours on her vertebrae as well as 5 vertebral fractures. Since then she has bravely undergone chemotherapy, a stem cell transplant and has had to deal with so much physical and mental pain. She's been making an excellent recovery, thankfully.  
Recently she has been getting her childhood vaccinations as the transplant wiped out previous vaccines. The nurse at the Health Centre, had vaccines delivered to our home. We thought this was a bit strange. We've kept them for months until wife was able to get vaccinated according to the protocol she was sent home with after her stem cell transplant.  
So 6 months after transplant we go in to start the vaccination process. This nurse immediately got defensive telling my wife that they are snowed under and don't have the time. Started going on about how a 10 minute slot isn't long enough to draw my wife's blood and that they wouldn't do it. One vaccine was expired they said. Was very curt with my wife and made her feel terrible as if all of this was her fault. Gave her 2 jabs and sent her on her way with blood running down her arm and elbow which frightened me as wife has low platelets and is at risk for infections.  
This nurse's disrespectful demeanour and lack of empathy towards my wife was appalling. Imagine going through all of what my wife has been through, hobbling in on crutches because of the terrible cancer and being treated so very wrongly! I hope this nurse gets some mental healthy support or even stops working with the public as they acted truly awful to us and I hope they never treat anyone that way again.

author: Ricrd79
title: Care and kindness
body:
I called up in 07/21 regarding a very aggressive and inflamed bum hole, I revived a call back from Clara she was very helpful and even with the clinic being under a lot of pressure and booked out she was very Compassionate, caring and understanding to my current condition as I was in alot of pain at the time, Clara booked me in for the next day I was so great full as the pain was beyond comprehension,  
On the day I was called up by Clara to be tested she was very thorough and caring I really feel for Clara and the rest of the staff at Bishton court you can tell they are under some Immense pressure and dealing with high demand I can’t highlight how amazing Clara was as well as the rest of the staff I really felt looked after and cared for, thank you so so much and please look after the staff here they need a good vacation and soon!

author: Claire J
title: I had gallstones
body: I was so unwell and very frightened I had gallstones the staff was very understanding and gave empathy kindness. I was giving real care and support with empathy

author: Sambam
title: Breastfeeding
body:
Due to a tough time giving birth ( blood loss , severe tear and gettting antibiotics) I was delayed in starting breastfeeding and my body was trying to recover.  
The hospital staff although helping me to breastfeed also offered to feed my baby formula during the night so I could sleep. I gratefully accepted but didn't realise what an impact that would have on my supply. I wish they had explained that it might stop milk flow or had more knowledge about it as I wouldn't have given in despite being so tired.  
Once back home I was sore and healing and found breastfeeding very hard going. It was sore and neverending. As it turned out my baby regained his birth weight fine initially but it was the following weeks and months later that he deviated from the average weight. I was determined to solely breastfeed and was introduced to the breastfeeding team from fife. They provided me with a double expressing machine to use up to 5 times a day to encourage milk production and also came out to help.  
After weeks of persisting however my milk production still seemed low and baby wasn't gaining enough weight, and with advice from my healthvisitor and breastfeeding team we decided to give a bit of formula. Within weeks he was gaining and obviously just needed some calories. He was much happier too and clearly not so hungry.  
The breastfeeding team were available on the phone all the time and helped me with a wee routine to stick to which would not interfere with my milk production. Over the next month the changes were amazing and he grew considerably. We are very grateful for the advice and help in those scary first few months.

author: saturnhg33
title: Mental health support and autism support
body:
I have a son with asbergers syndrome. He has been suffering with his mental health for the past two years. Over the last year and a half he has spent six months in hospital on three different occasions.  
He is now living in a flat because we were told by the social worker he would get more support in the community.  
Initially when he moved into his flat he had support from framework and the enablement team (for two hours a week) and a mental health nurse. Very quickly (around three weeks) after he came out of hospital, the framework team and enablement team stopped working with him. He only has a deepo jab once a month., and I believe the mental health nurse has very little contact with him.  
At no point has the fact that he is on the autistic spectrum been addressed. He has pushed some support away. I know that he struggles socially and mixing with people. This should have been taken into account with providing support for him.  
I recently heard about the transformation project in mental health. It is supposed to offer a wrap around person centred approach to treatment. To be honest my son's autism has never been addressed by any of the mental health teams he has worked with. This has really has impacted how affective the treatment is. He has pushed back on much of the treatment he has been offered. Because of this he is living in a flat virtually unsupported.  
I was told by his first psychiatrist that mental health support for autistic people in Nottinghamshire is particularly bad.  
I think it is only a matter of time before he is readmitted to hospital.  
I am writing to you in total disgust for the support my son has been offered.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Kate08
title: Unable to visit due to restrictions due to covid.
body:
My mum was in ward 3 north, we are a large family, and my father was unable to visit as well as my sisters and brothers due to restrictions due to covid.  
I picked up the leaflet at reception and was able to get my Father and siblings connected very quickly. It was amazing when everyone could see and talk to mum, it lifted so much worry. The people who set up the calls were fantastic and really did make the process quick and easy. I just think this service is an extremely important for the times we live in and really really was wonderful for our family.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Robert66
title: Angioplasty
body: I was admitted as a day patient to the Day Intervention Unit at Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy in June 2021. In spite of being extremely nervous I was to remain awake during my operation which they had advised could take some time. Luckily for me the nurse in charge of my care (Bobby) and the rest of the team there were wonderful and managed to keep me calm throughout the entire procedure. My surgeon Dr Bhat was so gentle and managed the procedure quickly and very efficiently in a lot less time than I was at first told (much to my relief of course). Thank you so much to Bobby, Dr Bhat and everyone else involved in my care that day. Your kindness and humour made a very stressful procedure far easier and for that I am very grateful.

author: MJS66
title: Fantastic care given to my uncle
body:
My uncle has been ill for many years now. Having gotten considerably worse over the last couple of years he has spent a vast amount of time in and out of Forth Valley Royal Hospital in Falkirk. The care, attention and help he has received is second to none from the Doctors surgery to the paramedics, ambulance service and all staff at the hospital has been exemplary.  
The NHS in the UK not just Scotland has had a lot of recognition this year for the handling of the pandemic, words like saviours, angel's etc have been branded around very much and rightly so, where would we be without them all.  
Carers in care / nursing homes nursing staff in hospital's are generally instructed to keep emotions at arms length however my uncles condition which is now considered as end of life really relies on someone keeping a very close eye on him as much as possible, as a family we could not be happier with the very high level of care given to him. Amazing,  
I know there are many more staff involved and I don't know if this form will allow me to name names further on so I will take the chance now to do it. The 2 main staff dealing with him at FVRH ward 31b are Frances and nearly qualified student nurse Julie, ready to qualify in a few weeks and heading on elsewhere ( big loss to FVRH)  
Thank you very much to all staff throughout the hospital for all your care and compassion.

author: The unhappy
title: The only shelter we have from this heat
body: Today it is 23 degrees in Wishaw and due to one person smoking in the court yard all 22 patients are being contained in the ward.   Instead of punishing the non smokers it should be the smoker who is confined to the ward.   Yes there are limited walk groups however the court yard is the only shelter we have from this heat. In a mental health ward where it is volatile already this is not only irritating but is also unbearable

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am getting the best care I possibly can get
body:
The first thing I have to comment on is the nursing staff. They are hard working, knowledgable and friendly, they honestly cannot do enough for me and I admire their caring qualities. I also enjoy the good times I have with the nurses as they are always up for a laugh and a joke which brings a bit of life to the ward and makes my stay here more enjoyable.  
Every single member of medical staff I have interacted with have communicated everything to me very well and in language that I can understand. In particular a consultant called Mr Neill had an excellent manner of explaining my illness to me and the treatment plan for what's next, when talking to him I wasn't afraid to ask questions and knew all my questions were being answered in the best and most detailed way possible for me to understand. I got some bad news from another consultant who was called Mr Mark although the way this bad new was broke to me was exemplary and I felt it was in the most appropriate manner possible.  
This ward is very good and I have enjoyed interacting with other patients in my bay, I feel the bad news I received gave the other patients on the bay a chance to sympathise with me and express their feelings which made us all become closer and I have really enjoyed the bond created between the four of us. Additionally I would like to comment on the continuity of care which I have received on this ward as no matter how many staff change overs there is, all staff are kept up to date with my care and are able to take over when one nurse leaves etc this reassures me I am getting the best care I possibly can get.  
On the ward I feel like I get enough privacy when I need it, although as I have said before I do enjoy the social aspect of the ward. I really enjoy the freedom of being allowed out for a walk twice a day as it gets me off the ward and into some fresh air, this has been a very positive element of my stay. I think the menu is good as there is a good variety and I also get more than enough access to water.  
One thing I could suggest an improvement on would be to have the option of coffee/tea given in the afternoon as it's a long wait from lunch to dinner. Additionally I feel GP's need to be doing a lot more for patients. I myself presented with stomach pain on multiple occasions to the GP and nothing was done that needed to be, I had to present many times before I was referred on and perhaps if I was referred earlier for tests and scans I would have got a diagnosis much much sooner. I feel the work of the GP is not the same as the work of the hospital doctor.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everyone is so welcoming and helpful
body:
Overall I really don't have much negative to report. The staff have been amazing especially the nurses who have all been brilliant, confident and kind. Communication has been first class and with my hearing difficulty staff have no problems having to repeat something they have already said or speak to me in a louder voice than usual.  
I haven't been afraid to ask any of the staff for anything as everyone is so welcoming and helpful. Any questions I have asked the medical professionals have all been answered in the most detailed and informed way possible. I like how staff keep me up to date with my treatment and I know I am listened to.  
This ward is spotless and the cleaning staff go above and beyond to keep the ward in pristine condition. I like how the ward is a nice bright space with the blinds open so I can see out, I makes the area feel less claustrophobic. Fortunately I had an extremely fast movement from A& E up onto this ward and additionally I have had very short waits for scans and blood tests throughout my stay. I would really like to see the nurses get more rest as they are never off their feet.  
Finally in terms of food I really enjoy my meals and find them extremely nutritional for someone like myself who is recovering. Water is always available to me. Huge appreciation to all staff and everything they did for me. THANK YOU!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: So far I have been treated very well
body:
I was took in this morning and so far I have been treated very well. The staff have been very very good and I admire how competent they are in their work. Everything so far has been communicated to me very very well and any questions I have had so far have been answered more than well, and in enough detail in terms of what the staff know so far. Fortunately I didn't have long to wait atall which I am very grateful for.  
Overall so far I can't suggest any improvements, the staff have been more than facilitating as even now when they don't have enough ward rooms in ED or on the wards I feel I have been given enough privacy through use of dividers between myself and other patients. I would like to be moved up onto a ward as soon as possible but I know staff are doing their very best for me as it is. I would have liked some visitors in to keep me company but I understand this isn't possible due to covid restrictions.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ossie21
title: All staff were excellent
body:
Original referral was one year past March. Although surgery was required it was put on hold understandably because of COVID.  
Surgery was again scheduled for April 2021 and got as far as the pre op assessment before being cancelled again as my GP wanted something else checked first.  
Surgery again scheduled for July 2021 and this time went ahead.  
Understandably I was nervous and anxious but all staff from the Consultant, assessment staff, theatre and ward staff were excellent.

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: All the staff have all been amazing
body:
First of all the staff have all been amazing. Communciation between myself and the nurses has been good but I would critique communication between myself and the consultant.  
I feel like the consultant's communication style could have been a lot better and there is definitely room for improvement, I would also like more frequent updates on my illness and treatment from the doctors. One thing I would say though is that I feel listened too and involved in decisions made by staff regarding my care. In terms of the ward I think I get enough privacy and enough space. I feel safe on the ward and am surprised at how clean it is. It is a credit to the cleaning staff here in the hospital. Additionally I get more than enough pain relief when needed which makes me comfortable in my recovery.  
In terms of my A&E experience I didn't have much of a long wait but to get a bed in the ward I had a very long wait but I understand as the hospital is very much understaffed which makes them very very busy. A lot more money needs invested into the hospital sector to reduce these waiting times due to understaffing in the hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I would have liked more time with the doctors
body:
The staff in craigavon are absolutely brilliant and are run off their feet. Their communication skills are immaculate and I admire especially the competence of the nurses on the ward. Everything to date has been communicated to me well so far except on one occasion this morning.  
I was just finishing my breakfast and 2 doctors came up to my bedside and told me I would need to go in for an operation today. I was just awake and found in hard to take in all the information they were throwing at me all at once, I didn't fully understand what they were saying to me and they seemed very rushed so I turned down the operation today. I would have liked more time with the doctors so they could better describe what the operation entailed.  
Additionally I didn't really feel listened to as I feel my pain is coming from a hip replacement I had in the 90's but I don't feel like the staff agree and think it's more to do with an injury on my spine although they haven't told me much detail about this and I don't feel informed. Before this incident any staff I encountered had explained everything very well and I haven't hesitated to ask a question of any kind.  
The food is quite nice and there is a good variety, also I get more than enough water. In terms of privacy I am content and I feel safe and comfortable on this ward. I get more than enough attention and am not afraid of being in the care of the nurses on this ward,

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I feel listened to by staff
body:
The staff have all been extremely pleasant and helpful. Communciation has also all been very very good. I am confident around the staff and have no fear in asking any questions, with all answers being detailed and keep me informed. My care and treatment is all explained very very well. I feel I get enough privacy on the ward. I am fortunate to receive pain relief as and when I need it.  
One thing I would say is that the ward is very understaffed. I know I am involved in decisions surrounding my care and feel listened to by staff which is a positive. The ward is very clean and the facilities like the showers and toilet are excellent. The food is good and I have enough acces to water. I wouldn't be afraid to have any of my personal belongings out on show. Although one thing I could suggest would be do get the t. v up and running again as I find myself getting very bored during the day.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: I am content with the care I am receiving
body:
After seeing many healthcare professionals outside of hospital I feel that the hospital has been the best place to receive care so far.  
As a blind individual I feel the staff have been more than helpful to me and are available whenever I need them no matter what the time. The staff have been outstanding and have communicated everything to me extremely well. Any questions I have are answered in a reasonable time and it reassures me when staff go and get a second opinion as I know the answers they provide are informed and competent.  
I also suffer with type 1 diabetes and on one occasion I feel the staff didn't listen to me regarding my condition. As a diabetic of over 40 years I know when I am going into a low and when I called to get help from the staff I feel I want listened to at all, when I knew I was right.  
Overall I can't complain too much as the ward facilities are absolutely first class. I get more than enough privacy. One thing I would say from a diabetics point of view, I feel there needs to be a lot more variation in terms of slow release carbs as a lot of the items on the menu especially for breakfast aren't the most suitable.  
I appreciate all the help I have got in this ward and am comfortable, safe and most importantly content with the care I am receiving. Huge thanks to my whole care team and all they do.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: All good so far
body: The hospital has been all good so far. I was brought into the hospital via st John's ambulance service, this service was quick and efficient and the ambulance staff were helpful and communicated everything very well to me. When I arrived at the hospital I had to wait in the hospital for 30 minutes but after that I was seen to extremely fast. So far the doctor has communicated everything to me very well. The service has been very good and I have got plenty of food and water. So far I can't really comment on any improvements. All staff have been very kind and helpful and I know I'm going to be looked after well.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: bravowm53
title: Deputy ward sister
body: My daughter was an inpatient here and understandably as a family we were so anxious and worried. Catherine was so busy however nothing ever seemed too much, she always took time out to check in on us as a family in such a caring manner. She is a great nurse, very caring and compassionate. I would like to say a huge thank you for looking after my daughter.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Not my first experience in ED CAH
body: This isn't my first visit to ED as I am frequently in and out of hospital. I was discharged just 3 days ago and I'm back again now. This time especially I have been seen very quickly. My bloods were taken almost immediately as soon as I got in through the door so I'm now just waiting for my results. I think everything has been communicated to me very very well so far. I have already seen 2 doctors and they have both been very nice. I suppose the waiting facilities aren't great as the seats arent very comfortable and I feel like everyone is very close. There isn't much privacy in the corridors which isn't too good and as so many people are walking or are being wheeled past I often feel at risk of getting another illness when sitting out in the open.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Every member of staff is doing their very best
body:
I think I am very well looked after in this ward by both doctors and nurses. I feel every member of staff is doing their very best to ensure that I am well looked after and I am comfortable in the ward. Communication from all staff is very good and I am never fearful of asking questions as I know the staff are there to help me. All my questions are answered quickly and efficiently and it reassures me when staff know what they are talking about.  
I would like a little more privacy on the ward as often at times it gets a bit much constantly seeing the other patients although by no means do I feel unsafe on the ward and given the nature of the NHS service I am content and grateful with the space I have been given.  
I am amazed at the cleanliness of the area and it is a credit to the cleaning staff. It's hard to get a temperature that everyone on the bay is happy with but the staff are very accommodating and offer to open a window of I'm too warm or give me extra blankets if im too cold.  
One thing I would say is that at night the ward can be very bright depending on the sister in charge, additionally where my bed is situated I can see onto the corridors leading to other wards which means constant light in my eyes and this often makes it hard for me to sleep, I think if the hospital even reduced the lighting at night by half they would save an abundance of money.  
Overall nothing I could suggest improvement on could get sorted at this level, things like better facilities and waiting times ect all need to be sorted out at a higher level than the staff here as they are only doing their job. The health sector needs more funding and that's the bottom line.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: It has really been a very positive experience
body:
I have been in 1 day so far and it has really been a very positive experience. The nurses and doctors have been more than good to me. Communication between the staff and myself has been very very good and everything has been explained to both myself and my daughter (who cares for me) extremely well.  
In terms of the ward environment I think it is very good and I get enough privacy. I feel comfortable and safe on the ward and enjoy the food I get, there is plenty of variety. The staff on the ward both doctors and nurses are doing an amazing job and I can't suggest any improvements.  
I was admitted through A& E and that experience was good enough as I wasn't waiting for too long and was moved up and into a ward very fast. The hospital is very clean and facilities like the toilet and the shower are very accessible. Staff have an admirable attitude towards their job and it makes me feel safer in their care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Big thank you to all the staff
body: So far I have been in 3 days and couldnt fault the place. I am amazed at all the apparatus they have here and the staff have been amazing. Everything has been communicated to me so well and the people on the ward are also pleasant and nice which makes my experience even better. At this moment I can't suggest any improvements. Big thank you to all the staff for being so good at what they do.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Netty36
title: Gynae services
body: I had an appointment at Lincoln county hysteroscopy clinic today after being referred by my GP for bleeding and menopause problems. I saw Nicky the nurse and Marie and Olivia the support staff who are fantastic at what they do. Every step was explained to me before the hysteroscopy. I mention that I had wanted the mirena coil fitted but my go surgery refused to do. Nicky spoke to a consultant in the department and they agreed it could be fitted there and then. The hysteroscopy and biopsy was quick and pain free. Yes it was uncomfortable at times but nothing like the horror stories you read. The staff explained what was happening at every stage and I could see the procedure on the screen. I cannot thank them enough for all they have done for me today after months of suffering with menopause symptoms, they showed empathy and understanding of my issues whilst respecting my dignity. Thank you all for the care given. Well done x

author: LMD13
title: THE best place to have your baby!
body:
I’d like to share my positive pregnancy and birth experience at Peterhead Community Midwife unit to encourage all mums to go there if it’s an option for them. I have received exceptional care right from the very start of my pregnancy. Sheena and Natalie have been so caring and have gone above and beyond to support me every step of the way. I was very anxious this time around following 2 miscarriages after the birth of our son but they put my mind at ease from the first appointment.  
All of the staff have been extremely friendly and informative during our scan and antenatal appointments. From my experience Peterhead is a much more personal and calming experience than other hospitals I have attended previously. I had my heart set on a water birth with my son but due to my waters breaking before any contractions started and the risk of infection I was recommended to deliver in Aberdeen - which I absolutely can’t fault at all but was disappointed I didn’t get my planned water birth.  
This time around our baby girl kept us waiting for 13 days past her due date but I eventually got my water birth in Peterhead which was every bit as amazing as I’d hoped. Special thanks to Kelly for her outstanding care, who made us laugh and made my husband feel looked after too!  
We were made to feel so relaxed and nothing was too much bother after our daughter was born and although I’d breastfed my son it was reassuring to have the support and advice again from all the staff. I could not have asked for a better pregnancy and birth experience and I am extremely grateful to all of the staff at Peterhead CMU.

author: Dinah64
title: Routine smear test
body:
I’d like to say thank you to Bridget (specialist nurse) at West Farm Surgery, Longbenton Newcastle! I’m 56 years old and I had the first pain free and discomfort free smear test “ever” this morning! It was completed within seconds!  
Bridget's supportive manner and chat put me more at ease! There was no grinding of an instrument and she had completed the procedure before I had thought she’d even started!! I was so gob smacked, I was in disbelief when she indicated it was completed within seconds. I informed Bridget how delighted I was and explained that was the first time I have ever felt pain free and at ease, I’d like to say that she definitely understands this procedure and has learned to offer it with such a delicate care and pain free experience, which will hopefully only encourage more women to “relax” about going for a smear! I will be telling the many women I work with to go have their smear without fear from Bridget at West Farm surgery! Thank you Bridget for your professional expertise!!

author: Elliem7
title: They made me feel embarrassed and upset
body:
I rang to check the time I should collect the event recorder from the clinic.  
When I mistakenly referred to the event recorder as an ECG, the staff member I spoke to audibly sniggered and told me that it was called an event recorder. They were extremely patronising.  
When I then told them the reason for my call, they questioned why I was calling and that I should have been given the time when I came in. I said I couldn’t remember so wanted to double check.  
I thought their response was rude, unprofessional and unnecessary. They made me feel embarrassed and upset.  
The nurse who showed me how to use the event recorder was really nice and patient. They reassured me about the process.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: apusge34
title: My op
body: all the medical team were brilliant nursing staff were fantastic, just cant thank everyone enough.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: volansrc46
title: Lack of breast feeding awareness in paediatric ward
body:
Recently ended up in ward 29 with my then 10 day old baby who was diagnosed with congenital pneumonia and required CPAP. Cannot fault the staff in terms of their care as all were lovely and acted with compassion at what was a difficult time. However, I feel it's important to highlight the issues we encountered around the lack of support for continuing our breast feeding journey.  
The ward is clearly not set up for supporting breastfeeding mother's, particularly those who are in the early days and just beginning to establish feeding. There was a lack of understanding from staff about how to source and then subsequently use the hospital grade pumps which were crucial when my son was requiring tube feeds to keep up my supply and to provide his nourishment. Thankfully I was aware of the infant feeding team based within ninewells due to my eldest son, however when one of the team initially tried to come to the ward to provide support, the charge nurse didn't allow them access. It was then a further 24 hours before they were allowed in to support me and source appropriate pumps etc by which time my nipples were damaged. For a hospital that has a gold standard award for breastfeeding, I feel that paediatric ward let's the hospital down.  
The paediatric ward also did not appear to have all of the resources required to effectively support babies who are pre term and advice had to be asked from the NICU team to source appropriately sized equipment to look after him. It is frustrating that babies who have been discharged from hospital after birth are then no longer able to access the NICU and are put straight to the paediatric ward when had the hospital picked up when he was born that he had congenital pneumonia, he would have ended up in the NICU and therefore been in the most appropriate place to meet his needs.

readBy.name: Office of Joe Fitzpatrick, MSP for Dundee City West

author: Daisy35
title: Bad cut in leg
body: Took my son down after he had an accident with his bike, he had a big deep cut so took him straight down to minor injuries, when I got there I was asked if I had phoned 111, I obviously hadn't as I panicked and from previous experience waiting on them calling back takes some time. Once we got in, communication from the lady on reception was great and my son was taken within a very reasonable time, the nurse was brilliant and made a great job of tidying up my son's leg with stitches and giving advice on how to look after it etc. All in all a good experience.

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

author: taurusnf95
title: receiving help from S.T.A.R.S
body: Im in my 30's and have four children. I Lost my mother at 14 started to drink I was in the madness for years it became the norm. yrs later I needed help. So I reached out to S. T. A. R. S who helped me. I am now on the mend and it a better place.

author: andromedafx46
title: Excellent service
body:
Excellent service at this clinic. All the staff from my receptionist to the nurses + doctor very helpful. Dr Nandy put my mind at rest regarding my symptoms + treatment. Can ask him any questions no problem.  
Kayleigh the nurse helps me up and makes sure I am okay re my vertigo!  
Kayleigh  
Dr Nandy  
Just wish the clinic was newer!

author: Skyebo
title: This is a valuable service
body:
I work in Social Care & was escorting a service user who experiences mental health issues to the UCC for assessment. The staff on duty were extremely respectful & sensitive to the SU's needs, they recognised the individuals anxiety & ensured their approach was supportive & compassionate.  
They took time to explain all of the processes & tests they would like to carry out, whilst ensuring the SU knew that they had a choice to accept these or not. The staff also made me feel very welcome & were inclusive when discussing their procedures, they also encouraged my knowledge & experience of my role with the SU to assist them in their role. (A great example of collaborative work which despite the existence of the Health & Social Care Partnership, can sometimes fall short).  
A further visit the following day was met by the same welcoming approach showing consistency & continuity of care. I found this service excellent from the Advanced Nurse Practitioner, Staff Nurses, HC Assistants to the Porter escort to X Ray dept. This is a valuable service allowing people to be seen & treated promptly without necessarily needing to be admitted to the hospital. Thank you & well done.

author: peppercq49
title: Best thing to ever happen to me
body:
When Katie phoned me and explained she had put a group of people together who would be 'mental health' workers, I was doubtful at first but after having my stroke I felt very depressed and often had suicidal thoughts.  
What a huge difference these people made to my life. They helped me to laugh and to see my life was worth living, and to laugh again. I laughed at Adele and her 'positive pants' but one person had an enormous impact on my life. His name was Trevor. He was so genuine, caring, made me laugh. I am sure he was sent from heaven.  
We spoke about life in general and he gave me a positive view on life itself. I shall miss him so much and feel so grateful I got to know him. I will never forget him, meeting the team was the best thing ever to happen to me and I thank each and every one of them, for their kindness, love to all of you.  
You will never be forgotten Trevor.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: eaglers43
title: I can not thank all the staff enough
body:
I can not thank all the staff enough, the support I have received has been life changing and I can never thank you enough! Your work is incredible and has changed my life. Actually saved my life.  
P.S  
Special thanks to Lysley - you have been my support and lifeline

author: Gladiator
title: Emergency treatment of my 14 year old son.
body:
He was treated in A& E from approx 2100-2330 following an injury to his left arm at rugby training. He was initially accompanied by his coach until I arrived (his mum! )  
His treatment cannot be faulted, he was treated promptly, given analgesia, and made as comfortable as possible. He was sedated to reduce the dislocation before being discharged. Dr Wong, R/N Shaun and Az were brilliant in their care, professional and engaging to put a teenage boy at ease.

author: soiltc94
title: The nurses are good and caring
body:
I enjoy going the the hospice on a Thursday because I get to meet people.  
People that I now regard as friends. The nurses are very good and caring. They help me getting my medication. The nurses phone me every week to make sure I'm okay and if I need any help.

author: Kirrie Patient
title: Visited minor injuries unit at Whitehills Hospital Forfar
body:
Had injured my ankle and couldn’t put weight on it.  
The medical professional assessed my ankle and established it was a sprain.

author: corridorkc44
title: Lack of communication
body:
In 6/21 I went into Craigavon hospital to give birth I was admitted to MLU and the midwife I had was amazing. I had to be transferred to the delivery suite and the staff downstairs were quite the opposite. I have severe hearing loss, wear 2 hearing aids and lip read. This was all in my green notes yet no member of staff wore a visor or removed their mask to talk to me.  
My husband explained to each of them about my situation but they continued to talk amongst themselves with their masks on and backs turned to me. I had a very traumatic labour/delivery, had to be taken to theatre and the lack of communication between the staff and myself made the situation even worse. I am hoping my writing this may change the way staff treat patients with hearing loss differently in the future.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: delphinusqp85
title: staff were very kind
body:
Amanda + Kayleigh  
They were very kind. They listened to all my problems. Felt at ease when speaking to them. Made me feel very comfortable.

author: Fran01
title: A very unfortunate manner
body:
I have attended Orthopaedics at A&E on four separate occasions over the last four week, 3 have been GP referrals and 1 out patient appointment. On my second visit I was seen by a doctor who had a very unfortunate manner. Their level of patient care was extremely poor and during my consultation, they got facts wrong, spoke at me and was dismissive when I corrected them. When a person has distressing and concerning symptoms, that as yet have no diagnosis, they do not need a doctor to behave in this manner.  
Thankfully I have since seen a further 2 doctors, both of which were professional and personable.  
I also saw a doctor via A&E General medical and found them to be very helpful with a high standard of patient care. No thanks to that one other doctor, I have now transferred to Neurology.

author: woodpigeonkf73
title: Great care!
body: Second vaccine appointment- very professional and friendly. Love the NHS - thank you!

author: RachaelH
title: Exceptional Hawick community midwives
body:
Just want to say how amazing the care was I received throughout my pregnancy from the midwives in Hawick. Nothing was ever a bother and always felt supported no matter what the issue. Don’t feel like the Covid pandemic affected any part of the care I received.  
After I gave birth the home visits were especially reassuring, all my questions were answered and I felt supported to make informed decisions about the way I cared for my newborn.  
All aspects of my care were exceptional from both midwifes and the students.  
Thank you very much for everything x

author: carinare47
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great compassion and kindness
body:
Just called to praise OT Sarah, she showed great compassion and kindness when she went on a home visit.  
She was very patient when explaining the various procedures involved in the visit.  
Would like to give her a huge thank you and ensure that this message got to her Manager

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: branjd75
title: My hip replacement
body:
July 2021 at 0900 my right hip was replaced at the Victoria hospital in Kirkcaldy  
I was scared pre op however after two hours I was i the recovery room then thirty minutes later in the water feeling remarkable well just couldn’t feel my feet.  
A few hours later I was eating tea and toast provided by the excellent staff then a corn beef salad roll from my wive  
At this stage I was getting feelings back into my feet

author: MMM67
title: Thoughtful and Friendly Staff
body: Whilst attending for our second scan our baby no longer had a heartbeat - This was awful news and was really difficult to deal with (only two weeks prior everything looked ok). The staff doing the scan couldn't have been kinder and although there was lots of tears the support was unreal - information was made available but not forced onto you. I was really thankful for them providing us with a little memory box which made out process so much easier and gave us opportunity to talk when we really thought we didn't have words left to say. I then opted to have an MVA procedure which in my head was going to be the most traumatic experience ever but thankfully the kindness of the nurses and consultant made this process really easy and I was very thankful for the thought that was given to my partner during this time who couldn't be with me due to covid. Obviously this is a terrible time but I just wanted to say thankyou for doing a fantastic job! A real credit to the NHS!

author: Liam W
title: Quitting Smoking
body: I had help from Sharon and Michelle to help me stop smoking. They gave me help with information and provided Nicotine Gum which I found really helpful. I have now stopped smoking for  4/5 months and I am doing really well. It has made me feel more healthier, also made me question the amount of alcohol I consume and saving so much money too.

author: JeanPP
title: Visit to a heart specialist
body:
Had to have a heart echo and ecg, arrived at the proper time, was not kept waiting AT ALL, went into the cubicle, because it required me to remove all my top half clothes, the echo technician (John) was very considerate, helpful and friendly. He made sure that my dignity was preserved at all times. Then the ecg was provided by Dan, who was equally caring and considerate. At all times these two young men made me feel completely at ease with the procedures, they were professionals who deserve the utmost praise.  
Then I went into the clinic, the specialist I saw was a nurse specialist, Angie, and not only was she knowledgeable and friendly and helpful, whilst being totally professional, but she explained things very carefully, and in a way I could totally understand.  
In conclusion, my visit could not have been better, and all the professionals I saw were of a very high standard.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Kellie
title: Crawley Day Surgery
body: I recently attended Crawley Day Surgery unit for a  procedure using local aneasthetic.   From the moment  I walked in, every member of staff I interacted with was kind and professional.   I was looked after so well and I am extremely happy with the scar I've been left with.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Dee020773
title: Coil change
body:
I was greeted professionally and asked to wait a nurse came in and took me to take my height weight and stats I felt totally at ease with both the male and female nurse.
She took me through to the consultation room where I waited a minute for Wendy. Wendy went through everything clearly with me again I felt at ease and very comfortable.
I was asked to undress and lay on the couch Wendy then took out my old coil and replaced with a new one all the time asking if I was OK and explaining everything. I felt a little discomfort during the process and some sharp pain when the arms sprang out on the new coil, Wendy explained this was all normal.
I was asked stay lying down for a few minutes after the procedure, I then dressed the nurse and Wendy asked if I felt OK I said yes I did she then said I could go.

author: Denise20
title: My labour
body: I was induced for labour back in March. I simply couldn't have done it without my midwife Kirby. She was INCREDIBLE! When fully dilated baby was too high and a funny position. Babes heartbeat was also racing after contractions, she called in the doctor to assess me who decided to leave me for 1 hour to see how I progressed. Kirby still was unhappy with babes heartbeat after 30 mins so made the call to get me to theatre. With it being my first baby I was terrified, going from 4 people in our room to about 20 (shift change) it was all a bit much! Kirby was there by my side the WHOLE time. Both myself and my partner were so grateful to her helping deliver our daughter safely!

author: Laveyman
title: How dedicated and committed and professional the staff were
body: I was a patient on the ward and I wanted to say that the care, treatment and support given to me was fantastic. At a time when there are so many competing pressures and portrayal of healthcare services in difficulty it was amazing to see how dedicated and committed as well as professional all the staff were. They were led by a great ward manager, Patricia.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: statusgc58
title: Quality Care on the Medical Ward
body: I am getting on well in hospital. I had a reaction to getting blood drawn in my arm the other week and the doctors think it might be from my medications mixing. My whole arm came out in a rash and became quite swollen but after the doctors gave me some tablets the swelling went away. They aren't entirely sure what is wrong with me but the staff are great. Everyone is very good to me and kind.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sylvia Sunshine
title: The consultation could not have been better
body:
My husband and I came to see Doctor Mehta today having been referred by our local GP.I had the appointment letter in my hand as we looked for Yellow Wing. As we arrived in the wing a man immediately stopped and offered to help us to find where we needed. We thanked him and proceeded, we turned into the Assessment area and another man offered to help us.  
The reception/nurse person on the reception desk was very friendly and helpful. The consultation with Doctor Mehta could not have been better. He asked lots of questions and explained the medical terms perfectly. We both felt very relaxed  
and at ease, even the diagnosis of Parkinson's was made positively..  
I know my husband is in good hands.

author: flich63
title: Hospital  outpatent visit
body:
I attended the Dermatology Unit in July 2021 for a 4.30 appointment.  
I was seen by Dr. Vennerr at 4.40.  
Dr. Venner required a punch biopsy - this was arranged and I was treated & by the nurse - Terrie & her assistant Jo - all treatment completed by 6pm.  
A first class standard of care from start to finish - I now await the test results and am assured that the ongoing treatment I will require will be provided by a great team.

author: phasesp45
title: I was in safe hands
body: I was admitted to the Day Surgery Unit under the care of Gynaecology. The staff in the Unit, Consultant and Anaesthetist were amazing. They looked after me very well and it helped me feel calm knowing I was in safe hands.

author: likeablezy85
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Waiting for a consultation
body:
I initially went to Craigavon hospital where they wanted to send me to the hospital in Dungannon. I was instead brought to Daisy Hill as there was no room in Dungannon but I heard that Daisy Hill had a great fractures and physio service. I am waiting for a consultation with the physio and since being here  
the nursing staff have been great and have really changed my experience.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: warmqt77
title: My Weekly Visits to the Day Clinical Centre
body: Coming up to the ward fits my requirements well. the nurses up here really care for you, and would do anything that they could to help you. I come up to receive blood transfusions and over the past few weeks the whole process has been streamlined as I no longer have to get my bloods done by my GP, get a referral and then come for the transfusion. With the new system, as far as I understand I get my bloods done and I am then given an appointment to get the transfusion done. As well as this, I asked one of the nurses to contact my consultant about getting fluid drained and I was sorted out with an appointment to get this addressed. I am more than impressed with the care I have been receiving and I am grateful for all the help I have received.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: caringdd45
title: Great stay on Female Surgical Ward
body: I have been staying on the Female Surgical Ward and everything has been brilliant. The staff are so good and they would do anything for you. The food is also very nice.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hotelss43
title: The Care I've Received has Been Phenomenal
body:
I came up to the maternity ward this morning, I was booked in to have by baby turned to ensure a safer delivery when I am induced in the next couple of days.  
the nurses have been really helpful and have ensured that I have all the information I need regarding my delivery and my child's first few days. I have been receiving excellent care today and I have been blown away by how attentive the staff are, the nurses and midwives are always around if I need anything and are more than willing to help.
