It is also nice and peaceful up on the ward with it being a lot quieter than I thought it would be. overall the atmosphere on the ward has been very welcoming and so far my experiences are only positive.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: cheetahft57
title: Induction
body: I have been on the maternity ward since giving birth to my baby who was born prematurely and everything about my stay has been good. The staff in particular were brilliant. The nurses and midwives were very attentive and comforting when my baby had to be brought down to the special baby unit. The food was also really good. I honestly couldn’t suggest any improvements to my stay.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: lotionqz86
title: Everything has been brilliant
body: I came into the hospital for my induction. So far everything has been brilliant, even though I have only been here a couple hours, the midwives have been very attentive and have been checking up on me. They have made sure that I have all the information I need regarding my delivery and induction in the coming days. The nurses and midwives have been very nice and extremely welcoming towards me. I honestly don't have a bad thing to say about the care I have so far received and I am looking forward to the rest of my experience and getting to know my baby. The only thing that I think could be improved would be for there to be more nurses and midwives on the ward as it is clear that they are rushed off their feet

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: plusmh38
title: Waiting for an induction on the maternity Ward
body:
I was admitted to the maternity ward this morning after being seen in the assessment unit. I was kept very up to date with all the information I needed and was booked in for an induction on Friday. The staff are all lovely, however one  
suggestion I would have is to hire more staff as they are very busy. Due to the weather I was very warm on the ward and I’ve tried using a fan however it was too loud, so I think better air conditioning would be great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: marshk94
title: Nothing to Complain About So Far
body: I came in this morning for an appointment for my induction - the process of the induction went well and I would say that I have been well informed about the process and any complications that may occur. I have no complaints about my treatment so far and I have been well looked after by the whole team. I am doing well on the ward and all the midwives, nurses, and health care assistants I have met have been great. They are all very attentive and more than willing to come and help me out with anything I need. Nothing is too big of a request for them and they will always do their best to accommodate your needs.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hippown53
title: The whole environment was very relaxed and welcoming
body: I came to Daisy Hill to give birth and I have no complaints about my stay at all. The whole environment was very relaxed and welcoming. All the staff, the midwives, the nurses, were all very helpful during my delivery and after. They were quick, attentive and if I wanted anything I rang the call button and someone came to help straight away. Overall I had a great experience.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: The worst
body: The online consultation system is not functioning well. When there is a none urgent matter I do not mind waiting for an appointment for few days but when it takes few weeks and you have to chase it up soo many times and submit consultation form one after another.Is not right and it is mentally exhausting.  The receptionist seem to be under alot of stress understandbly, but I am taking the treatment of one of the receptionist to pals as she was insensitive and rude to my partner.The doctors and the medical staff are amazing.

title: An unpleasant experience
body:
Attended the clinic today for an echocardiagram.I was a little late for my appointment and the response to my apology from the sonographer was that she would now have to rush matters. Little courtesy or respect given .No attempt to alleviate my concerns.No explanation given to me of what she was doing or reasons why.
Suggest more training to put patients at ease during procedures

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Very efficient service
body:
I should like to thank the staff concerned at Cheadle Medical Practice who have been very helpful following a recent incident today.
I collapsed whilst on the street in Bakewell this afternoon and seem to have lost consciousness for thirty seconds, but recovered and returned home.  I then telephoned the practice and asked for advice, providing my blood glucose level, heart rate and blood pressure readings which I had just performed.
I was contacted soon afterwards by a very helpful doctor, who provided some welcome advice and offered a blood sample test and ECG, which was then arranged by the receptionist.  I'd like to thank both the doctor and the receptionist for their help and their very efficient attention in dealing with my problem, which obviously had caused me quite some concern.
I'd like to add that I have been a patient of this practice for many years and have found it to be excellent in all respects.

title: Awful Experience
body:
Had to visit the BMEC today after my daughter had an accident at school, and was advised by her optician to attend. 
Having worked for the NHS myself for nearly 20yrs I cannot believe the extremely poor organisation and lack of communication which led to a 7hr wait. 
The COVID guidelines were poorly adhered to, patients all sat together no wiping of seats or even wipes available to wipe the seats.
Waited for an hour to get into the building in the heat with no-one checking if anyone needed a seat (there were elderly patients with walking aids waiting) and no-one was offered water. Also I am sure there may have even been patients here that had not brought money to eat/drink not realising how long they would be waiting.
When in the building we were not made aware of the 2-3hr wait changing to 5+hrs and staff were rude or unable to assure us. We were triaged at 1pm after a 2hr wait to get into the building and be registered. Then waited until nearly 7pm to be seen there were people with appointment times of 10am still waiting with no information provided.
My daughters assessment took 10minutes in total, so surely a 13yr old seen earlier, would not only free up a space but also not allow for a child to wait nearly 7hours to be seen (was made aware at the end of the appointment there were staffing issues).
So much more could've been done to make the system run smoother and more efficiently, I have the upmost respect for everyone working in the NHS currently, but experiences like today could be avoided if 3 simple things were put in place:
1. Cmmunication
2. Empathy
3. Transparency

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust
